main event: Flares were observed in the NNW from an Alaska Native Service Station at various times from March 11th to 13th, 1951. A report of flares was made, but it was concluded to be non-UFO related.
interesting points: The observation involved the sighting of flares over a period of three days from the Alaska Native Service Station.
The conclusion of the report was that the observed flares were not UFO-related.
A plane was also sighted during the observation period, and rescue activities were initiated by the ACS Anchorage.
The report indicates communication between different military and rescue entities in response to the observed event.
The nature of the observed flares was considered to be possibly astronomical or related to weather and balloons.
witnesses: Alaska Native Service Station staff, Col Houston, ACS Anchorage
